reviewText: Haven't seen yet but I know it will be amazing from what I've hear/read. Hopefully getting from Santa. Free on Axs on 12/25. If you like this look for The Road Home from 1995. Guest is John Paul Jone from Zep.
We are Heart fanatics so this will make my wife's stocking better.
Heart is quintessential eighties. The bad girls who croon love songs.
Having seen this wonderful show, I was hoping for the complete show. What I got was the 1 hour show they put on AXS tv. The performances were great, but less than complete show lowers my score.
Ann and Nancy perform great...they always do!  Wish it was longer though....  Ann still can crank it up!
This was a gift for my husband. He just finished watching it and loved it!
I'm a big fan of Heart and love this video. Others would like it but maybe not as much. Heart Alive in Seattle is still their best in my opinion.
very good x-mas dvd heart are always good!
awesome bluray heart is refreshing to listen too

This was the worst Christmas show ever!  I'm a HUGE Heart fan and was hugely disappointed. Very little Christmas songs, it was slow and when they finally broke into some of their classic Heart, the tempo was off.  I'd really like my money back on this blu-ray.
Heart are one of the old good people
I had hoped to hear my favorite group singing heartfelt Christmas songs.  Very little Christmas music.  Very little Heart.  Almost no Annie Wilson.  I watched it once.  Probably won't watch it again.

The queens of Rock present a lovely Christmas show filled with family, friends and excellent music. This was an entertaining television event that we will enjoy watching year after year. The entire band filled the air with holiday joy! The Heart organization is a well oiled machine and never put out a bad product whether it's a concert, CD, book or TV show. Miles High Productions did a great job promoting this event as well as all their events. Chip Shultzman and crew should be commended for their marketing of a super group who still deliver excellent music and live theatre.
Christmas with Ann, Nancy and their talented friends....what could be better?
